alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 11:40AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring and expected to continue. * WHERE...Along the Big Wills Creek in Dekalb County. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 AM CST, Gauge reports indicate that Big Wills Creek remains above flood stage this morning, due to heavy rain and thunderstorms on Saturday. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Henagar, Crossville, Sylvania, Fyffe, Geraldine, Ider, Valley Head, Hammondville, Mentone, Pine Ridge, Lakeview, Guest, Collbran, Lebanon, Peeks Corner, Skirum, Chigger Hill and Desoto State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
